quote: Scientists are a friendly, atheistic, hard-working, beer-drinking lot whose minds are preoccupied with sex, chess and baseball when they are not preoccupied with science.
author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quote: Scientists have power by virtue of the respect commanded by the discipline... We live with poets and politicians, preachers and philosophers. All have their ways of knowing, and all are valid in their proper domain. The world is too complex and interesting for one way to hold all the answers.
author: Stephen Jay Gould,  Bully for Brontosaurus: Reflections in Natural History

quote: Science is a careful investigation.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Science, where would scientists be without it? They’d probably still be in my basement, where I left them a few minutes ago.
author: Jarod Kintz,  Seriously delirious, but not at all serious

quote: Every time a scientist publishes a good piece of work, she helps to maintain and raise the standards for what is true. We have to keep chipping away.
author: Deborah M. Gordon,  Ants at Work: How an Insect Society is Organized

quote: Science is the poetry of reality.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: The best scientist is open to experience and begins with romance - the idea that anything is possible.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Science is the process that takes us from confusion to understanding...
author: Brian Greene

quote: Science is interesting, and if you don't agree you can fuck off.Note: Dawkins was quoting a former editor of New Scientist Magazine, who is as yet unidentified (possibly Jeremy Webb)
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: Our true mentor in life is science.
author: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk

quote: Science is as corruptible a human activity as any other.
author: Michael Crichton,  Next

quote: Science is an attempt, largely successful, to understand the world, to get a grip on things, to get hold of ourselves, to steer a safe course. Microbiology and meteorology now explain what only a few centuries ago was considered sufficient cause to burn women to death.
author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

quote: Science is often misrepresented as ‘the body of knowledge acquired by performing replicated controlled experiments in the laboratory.’ Actually, science is something broader: the acquisition of reliable knowledge about the world.
author: Jared Diamond,  Collapse: How Societies Choose to Fail or Succeed

quote: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.
author: Adam Smith,  The Wealth of Nations

quote: Science is not a collection of facts. Nor is science something that happens in the laboratory. Science happens in the head. It's a flight of imagination beyond the constraints of ordinary perception. Columbus chapter -The Virgin and the Mousetrap
author: Chet Raymo

quote: The scientist is not a person who gives the right answers, he's one who asks the right questions.
author: Claude Lévi-Strauss

quote: Science is a way to call the bluff of those who only pretend to knowledge. It is a bulwark against mysticism, against superstition, against religion misapplied to where it has no business being.
author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

quote: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Science is always discovering odd scraps of magical wisdom and making a tremendous fuss about its cleverness.
author: Aleister Crowley,  The Confessions of Aleister Crowley: An Autohagiography

quote: Science is what we have learned about how to keep from fooling ourselves.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: Science is like sex: sometimes something useful comes out, but that is not the reason we are doing it.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: Measuring Love The only scientist who can measure love is the onewho's in love with another scientist.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Science, I am told, is making great strides, experimenting, groping after things which no sane man has ever dreamed of before – without being burned alive for it.
author: Walter de la Mare,  The Return

quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Will Durant,  The Story of Philosophy

quote: Science is the ultimate pornography, analytic activity whose main aim is to isolate objects or events from their contexts in time and space. This obsession with the specific activity of quantified functions is what science shares with pornography.
author: J.G. Ballard,  The Atrocity Exhibition

quote: Science is not a heartless pursuit of objective information; it is a creative human activity.
author: Stephen Jay Gould

quote: Science, my boy, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
author: Jules Verne,  Journey to the Center of the Earth

quote: Indulge your passion for science…but let your science be human, and such as may have a direct reference to action and society. Be a philosopher; but amidst all your philosophy, be still a man.
author: David Hume,  An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding

quote: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
author: Jules Verne,  A Journey to the Center of the Earth

quote: Science is a bit like the joke about the drunk who is looking under a lamppost for a key that he has lost on the other side of the street, because that's where the light is. It has no other choice.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: History repeats, but science reverberates.
author: Siddhartha Mukherjee,  The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer

quote: I believe that a scientist looking at nonscientific problems is just as dumb as the next guy.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: There are three stages in scientific discovery. First, people deny that it is true, then they deny that it is important; finally they credit the wrong person.
author: Bill Bryson,  A Short History of Nearly Everything

quote: Science is based on experiment, on a willingness to challenge old dogma, on an openness to see the universe as it really is. Accordingly, science sometimes requires courage - at the very least the courage to question the conventional wisdom.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: The difference between me and a scientist is a little word called “Science.” I don’t believe in it. Science has yet to validate my disbelief in Bigfoot.
author: Jarod Kintz,  Who Moved My Choose?: An Amazing Way to Deal With Change by Deciding to Let Indecision Into Your Life

quote: To know the history of science is to recognize the mortality of any claim to universal truth.
author: Evelyn Fox Keller,  Reflections on Gender and Science

quote: A real scientist solves problems, not wails that they are unsolvable.
author: Anne McCaffrey,  Acorna: The Unicorn Girl

quote: The scientist only imposes two things, namely truth and sincerity, imposes them upon himself and upon other scientists.
author: Erwin Schrödinger,  What Is Life? with Mind and Matter and Autobiographical Sketches

quote: Philosophers are people who know less and less about more and more, until they know nothing about everything. Scientists are people who know more and more about less and less, until they know everything about nothing.
author: Konrad Lorenz

quote: Scientific Discovery [10w] The greatest scientific discoveries were madelooking at the overlooked.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Science, you don't know, looks like magic.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: An experiment is a question which science poses to Nature and a measurement is the recording of Nature's answer.
author: Max Planck,  Scientific Autobiography and Other Papers

quote: Scientific People, unscientific mind; why are we dividing the world which could shine? Between religion and science, all what matters is human lives.
author: Santosh Kalwar,  A Very First Book Of Poems: Heartbreak

quote: I would suggest that science is, at least in my part, informed worship.
author: Carl Sagan,  The Varieties of Scientific Experience: A Personal View of the Search for God

quote: Science is the topography of ignorance.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

quote: There is something fascinating about science. One gets such wholesale returns of conjecture out of such a trifling investment of fact.
author: Mark Twain,  Life on the Mississippi

quote: Science is spectral analysis. Art is light synthesis.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: I love science, and it pains me to think that so many are terrified of the subject or feel that choosing science means you cannot also choose compassion, or the arts, or be awed by nature. Science is not meant to cure us of mystery, but to reinvent and reinvigorate it.
author: Robert M. Sapolsky

quote: Philosophy of science is about as useful to scientists as ornithology is to birds.
author: Richard Feynman
